posts.summary:
Artist: Jorge Marín

  Mexico 1963
  With over 25 years of artistic work, Jorge Marín has successfully entered into Mexico’s...
posts.caption:
crossconnectmag:

Artist: Jorge Marín

 Mexico 1963

 With over 25 years of artistic work, Jorge Marín has successfully entered into Mexico’s artistic scene and has become a representative of figurative international sculpture. The sculptures of Jorge Marín reflect in bronze the intrinsic strength and force that emanates from its creation and permits him to construct dynamic bodies, full of movement, which challenges gravity and rotates in space supported on one point.

 His work represents the struggle between the coldness of bronze and the diverse emotions that his subjects evocate: the perfect balance of the equilibrists and his winged figures has become his particular seal. Another notable trait in his work is the mask, an attempt to depersonalise his sculptures and become another medium of expression of a body that contains universal symbols in itself.

Check our Facebook for more original art.
Posted by Very Private Art

posts.summary:
Contemporary with Classical Roots - Kehinde Wiley
 Kehinde Wiley was born in Los Angeles in 1977, and the
African-American...
posts.caption:
crossconnectmag:

Contemporary with Classical Roots - Kehinde Wiley

Kehinde Wiley was born in Los Angeles in 1977, and the African-American artist works within the boundaries set by the Old European portrait masters like Titian. Wiley’s twist is that he frames the black cultural experience within the pomp, majesty and enormous gilded frames of white art history.

Wiley’s inspiration and work don’t exist in a vacuum. He openly acknowledges how heavily he’s influenced by the long string of artists and events that came before him with direct shout outs to the greats.  Thanks to Franglophone and .mic.  Follow Kehinde Wiley’s work on his Instagram.

Contemporary art doesn’t exist in a vacuum – find more on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

Posted by Lisa.

posts.summary: Sculptures by Olivier Duhamel  Olivier Duhamel strives to capture the beauty and the emotions he sees in his subjects of study...
posts.caption:
Sculptures by Olivier Duhamel

 Olivier Duhamel strives to capture the beauty and the emotions he sees in his subjects of study but his artist identity is constantly evolving and to describe him is aiming at a very elusive target indeed. He initially grew a reputation as a meticulous portrait artist and then established himself as a leading New Zealand sculptor for his delicate and elegant bronze figurines. However, one aspect of his practice remains constant in his source of inspiration, the female nude.

Check our Facebook for more original art.
Posted by Very Private Art

reblog.comment:

posts.summary:
Hyperrealism Paintings by Gerard Boersma. SUBMISSION
 info@gerardboersma.nl, 
 I paint people on the streets, in stores, public...
posts.caption:
Hyperrealism Paintings by Gerard Boersma.

SUBMISSION

info@gerardboersma.nl, 

I paint people on the streets, in stores, public transport and museums. They show the way people see themselves, interact or are influenced by modern developments in various ways. I freeze time and our fast and busy lives are forever captured in a moment. Finally ready to be observed quietly.

I’m a professional and international recognized artist for over 15 years well known for my own realistic style of painting. I currently live and work in Leeuwarden, The Netherlands.

Check us out on Instagram | Donate to support the blog!

posts.summary: The Witty Black and White GIFs of Rafael Araújo Rafael Araújo, originally from São Paulo, is a Motion Designer | Graphic Artist...
posts.body:
The Witty Black and White GIFs of Rafael Araújo

Rafael Araújo, originally from São Paulo, is a Motion Designer | Graphic Artist who works at Buck LA, one of the premier Motion Design firms.  In his spare time he creates animated gifs, many of them in Black and White, and all elegant and witty.

More unique art on Cross Connect Magazine:

Twitter || Facebook|| Instagram

Posted by David

 Sven Pfrommer is a Berlin-based professional photographer, visual artist,...
posts.caption:
Mixed Media and Photographic Work from Sven Pfrommer

Sven Pfrommer is a Berlin-based professional photographer, visual artist, and lecturer working worldwide. He is engaged in photography, painting, and printmaking since 1992. Please explore his editions, photographic and mixed media work on his website.

Enjoy past photography features and follow us on Facebook.

posts.caption:
Designs by Kristen Meyer

Kristen Meyer is a multimedia artist currently residing in New Haven CT. The spectrum of her career has included work in floral design, interior decorating, window design and prop styling.  To see some of Kristen’s current work, you can follow her website.

Meet us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram

posts.summary:
Animals by Amy Hamilton
 Amy Hamilton is a talented graphic designer and illustrator from Ontario Canada.  Her beautiful prints...
posts.caption:
crossconnectmag:

Animals by Amy Hamilton

Amy Hamilton is a talented graphic designer and illustrator from Ontario Canada.  Her beautiful prints of forest and other wild animals recall the feeling of coming upon these wild creatures and watching them from a distance as they move freely about in their native environments.  Thanks to Mandalsanat! 

You can get Amy Hamilton’s prints at society6.


Talent overflows at our Facebook Page.  Posted by Lisa.

Cross Connect is a proud partner of the Minuscule community network

Artists + Bloggers + Sponsors = Stronger Together

posts.summary:
Surreal Drawings by

Adonna Khare
 

Adonna Khare b. 1980 is an artist from Burbank, California mainly focused 

on carbon...
posts.caption:
crossconnectmag:

Surreal Drawings by Adonna Khare

Adonna Khare b. 1980 is an artist from Burbank, California mainly focused on carbon pencil on paper drawings. In 2012 she won the world’s largest art competition ArtPrize, competing against over 1500 artists from all around the world. Her instagram.com/adonnakhare/.

View similar posts  | selected by Margaret

The Daily Task

As a good resolution for 2013, Doze Studio, a motion design agency based in Nantes (France), came up with a crazy idea.
Each day, one  member of the crew have to think, create and play with a visual experiment and post it on Tumblr.

posts.summary:
Installations by Pamen Pereira
 Pamen Pereira is a contemporary and multidisciplinary artist born in Ferrol, Spain in 1963. 
...
posts.caption:
crossconnectmag:

Installations by Pamen Pereira

Pamen Pereira is a contemporary and multidisciplinary artist born in Ferrol, Spain in 1963. 

Her interdisciplinary work moves around sculpture, installation and sometimes photography or video, or just anything unrelated that is useful for specifying the creative act. Without leaving the solitude of the workshop as a place of reflection and study where she meets the most intimate, her current work focuses on site-specific installations and interventions, which defends the important function of the poetic image for society and, this way, art’s social character. 

View similar posts  | selected by Margaret via

posts.summary:
White Installation Art by Daniel Arsham

  Arsham challenges our perceptions of physical space, as walls melt or stretch like a...
posts.caption:
crossconnectmag:

White Installation Art by Daniel Arsham

 Arsham challenges our perceptions of physical space, as walls melt or stretch like a fabric in front of our very eyes. He is known for his use of white in artwork and installations. Why? His words:

 “I’m color blind, so part of it when I use that tonality, I know what I’m seeing and experiencing is the same thing you do because of the lack of color. It’s also a very simple idea of not altering materials.”

Check our Facebook for more original art.
Posted by Very Private Art

posts.summary: Illustrations by Elena Garnu Elena Garnu is a freelance Illustrator & Designer, based in Spain. I studied in Valencia, Albacete,...
posts.caption:
Illustrations by Elena Garnu

Elena Garnu is a freelance Illustrator & Designer, based in Spain.

I studied in Valencia, Albacete, and Murcia and now I am working at a well- known clothing store. I am an artist of little things. I every day explore new ways to draw. I try to beat myself, and that I am doing right now.

Visit her shop here.

Follow us on Facebook! WARNING - awesomeness inside.

posted by tu recepcja via

posts.summary: Paintings by Anna Matykiewicz Anna Matykiewicz was born in Poland. Moved to Ireland in 2003. While living in Ireland, she...
posts.caption:
Paintings by Anna Matykiewicz

Anna Matykiewicz was born in Poland. Moved to Ireland in 2003. While living in Ireland, she completed B.A. Degree from Visual Communication in 2005 in Poznan, Poland but remained in Ireland where she currently resides. In 2013 she left corporate work to fully pursue her career in art. Prior to this, she was working in many diverse areas, not related to art. She is mostly focusing on exhibiting and promoting her artworks through the internet. Her artworks are in private collections across the world. Follow her work on Tumblr and Facebook.

It’s easy to keep up with your favorite artists on our Twitter feed.

posted by tu recepcja
